Meaning: to climb, mount an animal, rise (as sun, moon, stars), rise in pitch (as a drum), get puffed up, (eyes) are turned up before death; (argas) to make climb, lift, haul up, take upon one's shoulders, lay a burden on, begin, raise, increase
Additional forms: Also KURargtaʔānā,argaʔānāto make climb, lift up, etc.; MLTargtreto lift, raise.
Notes: A good example on the differentiation of the 'active' and 'concealed'-j-in Kurukh verbal stems: the -j-preterite and simple preterite stems respectively reflect the unmarked and the causative meanings. In Malto the "concealed"-j-is implicitly indicated by the stop-g-(*arg-nāwould have yielded*arg̣-e).
See KR-17. In DEDR the Malto form is tentatively compared with Tam.ayir'to suspect', etc., but it is hardly reasonable to separate it from Kurukhasrnāto which it corresponds perfectly.

Additional forms: Also KURassAgtaʔānāto glue, paste or make otherwise adhere; MLTasgreto adhere;asg̣eto paste on, make of two things one.

Notes: The lack of vowel length in Kurukh is probably secondary (possibly due to the influence of nominal derivatives where the vowel was shortened before clusters). Inlaut -g-, -g̣- in Malto and -x- in Kurukh point to PNDR  *-q-  (PNDR*āq-nā>  Kurukhax-nā, PNDR pret.*āq-as>  Kurukhakkh-aswith the regular gemination *-q- > *-qq- > -kkh-). The preterite form in Malto - with gemination, no less - is unclear.

Word: mēca "an intoxicating beverage prepared of corn"
Additional forms: Also KUR (Hahn)māyā,mā̃yān_arrack made of rice.
Notes: A very complicated case. The PDR root is *maj-; however, in order to explain both the nasalization in Kurukh and the strange form in Malto, we have to suppose at least a specific suffix (probably modifying the original meaning 'intoxication' into 'intoxicating beverage'). And only a unique sound combination, like *-jnc-, could account for the unique correspondence Kur. -ãy- - Mlt. -ēc-. If this is the case, then in Kurukh *majnc- > *mãjc- > *mãj-, while in Mlt. *majnc- > *mēnc- > *mēc-. The problem is: what is the nature of this *-nc-?

Also KURpojjrnā,pojOrnāto coil or twist oneself round some object or person, be folded or wrapt round, involve (of a drapery), suit well; MLTpojg̣reto be wrapped or twisted, be entangled.
Also KURpuỹdnā,puīdnāto bloom, flower; (sun) sets in a glory of purple and gold; MLTpūtheto blossom.

Word: pūne (punḍ-) "to put on one's own neck (as a necklace)"
Additional forms: Also KURpundUrnāto pass round one's neck;pūnnecklace; MLTpundeto put on another's neck (a wreath or necklace);pūnunecklace, garland.

Word: pusre "a tree and its fruit so called"

Additional forms: Also MLTpūg̣pe,pūpg̣eboiled grain.
Also KURsaṛāsound, noise.

Word: care "to cut as with the teeth or scissors"
Additional forms: Also MLTcartreto cause to cut with scissors.
Also KURcaŋgrtaʔānā'to tickle, titillate, please (as a musical sound)'
Notes: MLT cēql- possibly < *cenql-.

Additional forms: Alsocopyeto chew (as sugarcane)

Meaning: a k. of tree from which arrow-shafts are made

Additional forms: Also KURcalxrnāto open (intr.); MLTcalgrotorn asunder.
Also MLTcen_yroscented, smelling.
Notes: Конечное -c корня реконструируется на основании инфинитива в курух.

Meaning: to remove in small quantities from a heap

Additional forms: Also KURcōdnāto lift up, raise, erect; MLTcoytreto raise up, awake, begin a song.
Also KUR refl.pass.takrnāto get a slight knock; MLTtakuwreto be pained or grieved.
Also MLTtareto break (as a stick), injure
Also KURtāgrnāto blow (of the wind); MLTtāgareto wave, undulate, fly with a waving motion as a sherd when thrown.
Also KUR refl. and. pass.tisgrnā
Also KUR (Hahn)tindīfast, immovable; (Grignard)tiū̃khnāto groan, moan under a violent effort, as when lifting a heavy load, fighting, etc.; (Hahn)tinkhnā,tiū̃xnāto strain, as at stool.
?Also MLTtotobeak, bill.

Meaning: to be in readiness for action

Word: tonqe "to bend, bend the knees slightly while dancing"
Additional forms: Also MLTtonqrobent.
Notes: Во всех остальных корнях с начальным *ṭ- оно, несомненно, вторично и возникло в результате ассимиляции с инлаутным ретрофлексным; это наводит нас на мысль, что в данном корне запись ṭ- в курух ошибочна (ср. малто, где начальный смычный не ретрофлексный).

Additional forms: Also MLTtodlqoṭeto stammer, lisp

Meaning: to bubble up (as foam when anything is being boiled), overflow.

Additional forms: Also KURtumʔtaʔānāto cause one to sneeze.
Also KURdumbhārōsp. of very long hornet;tumbilwasp; MLTtumbṛareblack wasp.
Notes: Вариант с начальным звонким, по-видимому, вторичен.

Word: tunde "to spill, shed, throw out as water"
Additional forms: Also KURtundrnāto be poured out, be spilt; MLTtundg̣reto be spilt, be shed.
Also KURtuppalxōsaliva, spittle; MLTtupg̣le,tulg̣pespittle.

Word: tuthr-kaṭe "to pass through a place, pass through (as an arrow)"
Additional forms: Also KURturdaʔānāto pass (a thread, string) through a hole, let pass an animal, help or allow someone to pass through any narrow aperture.
Also Mlttombratube
Also MLTturgeto bury the ashes of the dead. Cf. also MLTtun_ga,tun_gṛahollow of a bamboo or bridge, tube, tunnel.
Also KURoṛOgnā,oṛgaʔānāto believe, think, fancy, assume ('inside' - 'entrails' - 'heart' - 'mind'???); MLTugliheart, mind;ugleyeto think, wish, care for;uglareto remember;uglatreto remind.
Also KURumulkāurine; MLTumblmurourine (muroid.).
Also KURōnkāthirst;ōntaʔānāto give a meal, make drink; MLTondeto drink, colour, dye.
Also KURujjtaʔānāto keep alive, bring back to consciousness, raise again to life, revive (fire, quarrel); MLTujniliving, alive.

Word: use "to turn up the soil (as pigs do)"
Additional forms: Also KURugtāa plough, ploughshare.
Also KURoṛOknā(uṛUkyas) to strip a tree of its bark; MLTōṛyeto peel, unveil, drive away (as wind does the clouds)

Also KURhūthis;hū̃rā,hū̃dā,hū̃rū,hurūthat much of (shown from some distance), that much (i.e. as much as is with you, or as much as you said);hudā,huiyyā,husanthere (in the centre, or close to you);hujgōin that (intermediate) direction;hunnūby that way;huttrātowards that quarter, on that side (previously mentioned), on your side, in your village or country.

Word: ūde "to lift or prop up (as a screen)"
Additional forms: Also KURuddUrnā(uddras),udUrnā(udras) to lean upon a walking-stick;udur-udurēknāto walk leaning upon a stick; MLTūdure(udurya) to lean upon;udutreto prop up (as a screen).

Word: ūre "to blow (as the wind does), blow a fire or a trumpet, breathe upon (in sorcery)"
Additional forms: Also MLTūrtreto have exorcisms performed in case of illness.

Word: bate "to expose to heat for drying purposes, dry up (as water)"
Additional forms: Also KURbattaʔānāto empty, dry (tr.)

Meaning: to dawn, begin to grow light
Additional forms: Also KURbijjtaʔānāto protract till dawn.
Also MLTbalebalelarge ones.

Meaning: to cut the pulp of fruit or the fleshy part of a joint
Additional forms: Also MLTbālyeto cut up flesh
Also KURbālkōyellow; MLTbālkoyellow.

Meaning: a current or flood of water caused by heavy rain
to come, arrive, draw near, fall under the perception of the senses or the mind, be forthcoming

Additional forms: Also MLTbeduwreto be married.
Also KURbīṛīsun, time; MLTbiḍeto shoot forth (as rays)

Also KURbilctaʔānāto polish, cause to shine or glitter; be lightning;bilbilrnāto sparkle, twinkle, scintillate;billīlight, that which is a source of light (lamp, candle), flame, mental or moral illumination;belbelrnāto be an albino, have an unusual or morbid whiteness of the skin.
Also KURmendnāto tell, inform; MLTmendreto be heard, be rumoured

Notes: Гласный и согласный -s- восстанавливается на основании формы малто; на присутствие носового  недвусмысленно указывает курух (ср. также центрально-дравидийские формы типа колами vēnz-, найки vēnj- и др.; см. также ПСД *mesgā).

Additional forms: Also KURbā̃crnāto wear, put on (around oneself, as a mantle), wrap or drape oneself in; MLTbāsreto cover oneself with clothing
Notes: Условно реконструируемое сочетание *-nc-, по-видимому, в малто озвончилось, в курух же дает ожидаемый рефлекс (назализованность предыдущего долгого гласного + c).

Word: bithge "to expand, open (as the lips or eyelids)"
Additional forms: Also KURbidgrnāto be laid bare, get exposed to view.
Also MLTbiḍretreto disperse.

Word: bicre "to let go, put in, give"

Meaning: the name of the god of thunder and lightning

Word: caqe "to sting, pierce, stab; also applied to the sowing of certain grains for which holes are made in the earth"
Additional forms: Also MLTcaqroworm-eaten roots;caqtreto have the ears bored;caqushooting pains in the stomach.
Notes: Праформа - либо *caq-y-, либо *caG-.

Additional forms: Also MLTjarqtreto drop, let fall

Meaning: to shake down, beat down as fruits
